verses.verse: Then answered <WH6030> Eliphaz <WH464> the Temanite <WH8489>, and said <WH559>,
If one assay <WH5254> to commune <WH1697> with thee <WH3811>, wilt thou be grieved? But who can <WH3201> withhold <WH6113> himself from speaking <WH4405>?
Behold <WH3256>, thou hast instructed many <WH7227>, And thou hast strengthened <WH2388> the weak <WH7504> hands <WH3027>.
Thy words <WH4405> have upholden <WH6965> him that was falling <WH3782>, And thou hast made firm <WH553> the feeble <WH3766> knees <WH1290>.
But now it is come <WH935> unto thee <WH3811>, and thou faintest; It toucheth <WH5060> thee <WH926>, and thou art troubled.
Is not thy fear <WH3374> of God thy confidence <WH3690>, And the integrity <WH8537> of thy ways <WH1870> thy hope <WH8615>?
Remember <WH2142>, I pray thee <WH6>, who ever perished, being innocent <WH5355>? Or where <WH375> were the upright <WH3477> cut off <WH3582>?
According as I have seen <WH7200>, they that plow <WH2790> iniquity <WH205>, And sow <WH2232> trouble <WH5999>, reap the same <WH7114>.
By the breath <WH5397> of God <WH433> they perish <WH6>, And by the blast <WH7307> of his anger <WH639> are they consumed <WH3615>.
The roaring <WH7581> of the lion <WH738>, and the voice <WH6963> of the fierce lion <WH7826>, And the teeth <WH8127> of the young lions <WH3715>, are broken <WH5421>.
The old lion <WH3918> perisheth <WH6> for lack <WH1097> of prey <WH2964>, And the whelps <WH1121> of the lioness <WH3833> are scattered abroad <WH6504>.
Now a thing <WH1697> was secretly brought <WH1589> to me <WH241>, And mine ear received <WH3947> a whisper thereof <WH8102>.
In thoughts <WH5587> from the visions <WH2384> of the night <WH3915>, When deep sleep <WH8639> falleth <WH5307> on men <WH582>,
Fear <WH6343> came <WH7122> upon me <WH7461>, and trembling, Which made all <WH7230> my bones <WH6106> to shake <WH6342>.
Then a spirit <WH7307> passed <WH2498> before my face <WH6440>; The hair <WH8185> of my flesh <WH1320> stood up <WH5568>.

It stood still <WH5975>, but I could not discern <WH5234> the appearance <WH4758> thereof <WH4758>; A form was before mine eyes <WH5869>: There was silence <WH1827>, and I heard <WH8085> a voice <WH6963>, saying,
Shall mortal man <WH582> be more just <WH6663> than God <WH433>? Shall a man <WH1397> be more pure <WH2891> than his Maker <WH6213>?
Behold <WH539>, he putteth no trust in his servants <WH5650>; And his angels <WH4397> he chargeth <WH7760> with folly <WH8417>:
How much more <WH637> them that dwell <WH7931> in houses <WH1004> of clay <WH2563>, Whose foundation <WH3247> is in the dust <WH6083>, Who are crushed <WH1792> before <WH6440> the moth <WH6211>!
Betwixt morning <WH1242> and evening <WH6153> they are destroyed <WH3807>: They perish <WH6> for ever <WH5331> without any regarding it <WH7760>.
Is not their tent-cord <WH3499> plucked <WH5265> up within them <WH4191>? They die, and that without wisdom <WH2451>.
